Name: Mint Collins
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Lightly MUDDLE (just to bruise) mint in base of shaker. Add next 3 ingredients, SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. TOP with soda and briefly stir.
Review: A minty John Collins – just as the name suggests.
History: Adapted from a recipe in Victor Bergeron 's 1972 Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide (Revised Edition) .
Garnish: Mint sprigs bouquet. Serve with a straw.
